data.title: Minimum party for Planescape: Torment
data.text:
Invader Zim

Post by Tom O'Neill

Hi,

I'm about to leave Sigil to visit Ravel. I don't need much help with

combat--Dak'kon, magician NTO, Morte, and 100 or so blood charms would

probably be enough for most anything. And I don't want to dilute

experience unnecessarily.

there's no such thing in this game. this is a game about character

development, not just for TNO, also for the rest of the characters that can

join your party. the game would be much poorer if you left everyone behind

because you wanted the XP. you'll get your XP either way.

Post by Tom O'Neill

So my question is, would bringing Annah, Nordham, and/or

Fall-From-Grace along enrich the story going forward? E.g.,

yes.

Post by Tom O'Neill

1) Do any of the characters provide access to interesting/important

side-quests, dialogs, etc. going forward? E.g., Fall From Grace

implied it might be useful to fall in love with Annah.

yeah, all of them do. this is also different depending on your alignment. if

you leave one char spot open when you enter ravel's maze, you'll get the

opportunity to have Vhailor the mercykiller ghost join your party. both his

and ignus's fate depend on your alignment.

Post by Tom O'Neill

2) Do I *need* Annah's thieving abilities? So far Dak'kon's bashing

has opened everything of interest. Any other special abilities I

would need?

what do you mean by "need"? if you mean in combat, then no, this game isn't

about combat. if you mean in dialog and plot points, then yes. switching

back and forth between being a thief, fighter and mage also brings out

several subquests and extra dialogs and possibilities of learning extra

special abilities etc, depending on who you talk with each respective class.

-Invader Zim

James Garvin

Post by Tom O'Neill

1) Do any of the characters provide access to interesting/important

side-quests, dialogs, etc. going forward? E.g., Fall From Grace

implied it might be useful to fall in love with Annah.

hhmmmmm...most probably here. It depends on a few things, but it is

cool to have them with you at some points.

Post by Tom O'Neill

2) Do I *need* Annah's thieving abilities? So far Dak'kon's bashing

has opened everything of interest. Any other special abilities I

would need?

I liked Annah (if only for her REALLY sexy voice) and I really never

like Fall-From-Grace that much. Dak'kon is good to have and Morte is at

least going to get a job on Seinfeld. If you talk to any of your NPCs,

they can provide some insight into what is going on.

Post by Tom O'Neill

I'd prefer character names and general comments only, no spoilers.

Thanks!

I tried to be general!
